title.narrative: Giving For Change Project In Ghana

description.narrative:
The Giving for change Project is a five (5) year project which begins from 2021 to 2025. It is funded by Giving for Change Alliance (GfCA) which is spearheaded by an international Consortium consisting of the Global Fund for Community Foundations (GFCF), Africa Philanthropy Network (APN), Kenya Community Development Foundation (KCDF) and Wilde Ganzen (WG). The GfC programme sets out a bold vision for transforming how ‘‘development is done’’. The main goal is community and domestic philanthropy; recognizing that communities do not only have issues but assets as well which can be used to build the power and voice of communities. The objective of this project is to influence how development work is done by focusing on 3 elements; increasing local ownership, unlocking agency, strengthening communities to claim entitlements from different actors, especially the government. The GfC project is being implemented in eight countries globally, including, Ghana, Kenya, Uganda, Mozambique, Ethiopia, Burkina Faso, Brazil and Palestine. In Ghana, STAR-Ghana Foundation is the lead organization and WACSI is the key partner
The Giving for Change (GFC) Project seeks to promote domestic resources mobilization and philanthropy as a strategy for increasing local ownership and influencing civic action for inclusive development. The project is anchored on the recognition of the importance of domestic resources in increasing local ownership, unlocking agency, and strengthening communities’ ability to claim their civic and fundamental rights.

mailing-address.narrative: No 6. Sunflower Road, East Legon, Accra. GA-372-5902

title.narrative: I1.a Communities express their voice through CSAs and are empowered to take control of their own development

description.narrative: In the central domain we aim to unlock the collective power of local communities represented by Civil Society Actors (CSAs: community organisations movements informal groups and human rights defenders) to express their opinion through community philanthropy.

title.narrative: D3.a International donors support community philanthropy as a strategy for increasing the political dimension of CSA work from a base of increased ownership and legitimacy

description.narrative: In the third domain we challenge and change the existing practices of international foundations INGOs and bi- and multilateral donors in working with southern CSAs. We will advocate to put community philanthropy at the heart of their funding policy and to focus (more) on brokering diplomacy and technical expertise roles.

title.narrative: G. An equal and just society where civic space is open: all citizens can express their views and opinions freely organize themselves and exercise their rights.

description.narrative: Strategic objective: to enhance freedom of speech (both as a means and an end) by amplifying community voices claiming their rights towards power-holders through community philanthropy with the support of other state and societal actors in 8 countries.
